title: [Large-Scale] Remote Asynchronous Interaction Workshop for Strengthening Preterm Infant Care Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational neonatal physiology and nursing knowledge
context.additional_context: Project-based learning conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments. Focus on enhancing practical competencies through asynchronous learner interactions and case analysis

learning_goals: Learners can design personalized care strategies for preterm infants considering their physiological characteristics and the NICU environment.
A nursing intervention plan can be developed by combining technology-based monitoring tools and behavioral observation methods
Students can write team-based case study reports on preterm infants using the PBL approach and propose improvements incorporating peer feedback

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
